comments.title: Appliances Tested
comments.body: Built-in kitchen appliances present at the time of inspection were tested using normal controls unless otherwise noted. Portable or personal appliances were not evaluated.

ai.notes: Use as default overview when at least one major appliance was tested.

comments.title: Inspection Scope – Appliances
comments.body: The appliance inspection is limited to basic operation using normal controls. Internal components, timers, calibration, and specialty features are not tested.

ai.notes: Standard boilerplate for the appliance section.

comments.title: Range Operational
comments.body: The range/stove responded to normal controls and appeared to function as intended at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Range Burner Igniter Inoperative
comments.body: One or more range burners at (location) did not ignite using the automatic igniter. Cleaning or repair is recommended.

ai.notes: Use when a gas burner will light with a match but the igniter fails.

comments.title: Range Igniter Continues Sparking
comments.body: The range igniter continued to spark after the burner was lit. Adjustment or repair is recommended.

ai.notes: Use for comment you’ve used before: starter does not stop sparking after burners are lit.

comments.title: Range Anti-Tip Device Missing
comments.body: An anti-tip device was not observed for the range. These devices help prevent the appliance from tipping if weight is applied to an open door. Installation of an approved anti-tip bracket is recommended.

comments.title: Refrigerator Not Inspected – Personal Appliance
comments.body: The refrigerator present at the time of inspection appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not evaluated as part of this inspection.

ai.notes: Use by default when refrigerator is not clearly included with the sale.

comments.title: Refrigerator Operational – Basic Check
comments.body: A basic check of the refrigerator/freezer found it to be running and cooling at the time of inspection. Performance over time is not determined.

ai.notes: Use when you did perform a basic test.

comments.title: Microwave Operational
comments.body: The built-in microwave responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Microwave Not Tested – Portable
comments.body: Countertop/portable microwaves are considered personal appliances and were not evaluated.

comments.title: Disposer Operational
comments.body: The waste disposer responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Debris in Disposer
comments.body: Debris was observed inside the waste disposer. We recommend the disposer be cleaned and any foreign material removed to reduce the risk of damage or jamming.

ai.notes: Use for your frequent 'debris in disposer' / 'debris in disposal' observation.

comments.title: Disposer Leaking
comments.body: The waste disposer at (location) is leaking. Repair or replacement is recommended.

comments.title: Cooktop Operational
comments.body: The cooktop responded to normal controls and appeared to function as intended at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Cooktop Igniter Inoperative
comments.body: The automatic igniter for the gas cooktop did not function properly during testing. Cleaning or repair is recommended.

ai.notes: Matches the comment you’ve used: automatic igniter did not function during testing.

comments.title: Cooktop Breaker Off
comments.body: Power to the cooktop was turned off at the electrical panel at the time of inspection. The unit was not operated.

ai.notes: Use when you find the breaker off and choose not to energize.

comments.title: Oven Operational – Basic
comments.body: The built-in oven responded to normal controls and warmed when tested. Temperature calibration was not verified.

comments.title: Oven Not Tested
comments.body: The built-in oven was not operated due to (reason).

ai.notes: Inspector should fill in the reason: items stored inside, power off, etc.

comments.title: Washer Not Inspected – Personal Appliance
comments.body: The clothes washer present appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not inspected.

ai.notes: Use as your default stance since you only occasionally inspect laundry appliances.

comments.title: Washer Operated – Basic
comments.body: The clothes washer was run through a short cycle and appeared to operate without obvious leakage. Long-term performance is not determined.

ai.notes: Use when you *do* test the washer.

comments.title: Washing Machine Drain Pan Recommended
comments.body: The washing machine is located in a finished area of the home. Installing a properly drained washing machine pan would help reduce the risk of hidden water damage if leakage occurs.

ai.notes: Use when the washer is above finished flooring or over drywall/paneling rather than bare concrete.

comments.title: Dryer Not Inspected – Personal Appliance
comments.body: The clothes dryer present appears to be a personal appliance and may not remain with the home; it was not inspected.

comments.title: Dryer Operated – Basic
comments.body: The clothes dryer responded to normal controls and produced heat when tested. Internal lint accumulation and long-term performance are beyond the scope of this inspection.

comments.title: Dryer Venting Concern
comments.body: A concern was noted with the dryer exhaust venting at (location), such as excessive length, kinks, or non-smooth duct material. Correction is recommended for safety and efficiency.

ai.notes: You can tweak the specific issue when you insert it.

comments.title: Door Bell Operational
comments.body: The door bell responded to its test button at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Door Bell Inoperative
comments.body: The door bell did not respond to normal controls at the time of inspection. Repair is recommended.

comments.title: Trash Compactor Not Present
comments.body: No trash compactor was installed at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Trash Compactor Not Tested
comments.body: The trash compactor, if present, was not operated as part of this inspection.

comments.title: Kitchen Exhaust Operational
comments.body: The kitchen exhaust fan responded to normal controls at the time of inspection.

comments.title: Kitchen Exhaust Vents Indoors
comments.body: The kitchen exhaust fan appears to discharge back into the room or into a recirculating filter instead of venting to the exterior. While common, venting to the exterior is generally preferred to reduce moisture and cooking odors.

ai.notes: Use for over-the-range microwaves or hoods that don’t vent outside.

comments.title: Dishwasher Operational – Basic
comments.body: The dishwasher was run through a short cycle and appeared to operate without obvious leakage. A full wash cycle and drying performance are beyond the scope of this inspection.

comments.title: Dishwasher Supplied with Cold Water
comments.body: The dishwasher appears to be supplied with cold water. For best cleaning performance, most manufacturers recommend a hot water supply. Correction is recommended when practical.

ai.notes: Matches your prior comment about dishwasher on cold water, upgraded to repair if you want.

comments.title: Dishwasher Leakage
comments.body: Signs of leakage were observed at the dishwasher at (location). Evaluation and repair by an appliance technician or plumber are recommended.

comments.title: Dishwasher Drain High Loop/Air Gap
comments.body: The dishwasher drain line lacks a visible high loop or air gap at the sink. Adding a high loop or air gap is recommended to help prevent sink water from backing into the dishwasher.

ai.notes: Use when the drain line is low under the sink.

comments.title: Appliance General Tip
comments.body: Many appliances are near or beyond their original manufacturer warranty period. Future repair or replacement should be anticipated as part of normal home ownership.
